title: Chameleon Installation Guide (Recommended)
subtitle: Complete installation steps to ensure proper configuration of all dependencies
requirements.title: System Requirements
step1.title: Step 1: Install Node.js and npm
step1.download.title: 1.1 Download Node.js
step1.download.text: Visit https://nodejs.org and download the LTS version
step1.note.title: Note:
step1.note.text: Node.js includes npm (Node Package Manager) automatically
step1.install.title: 1.2 Install Node.js
step1.install.text: Run the downloaded installer and follow the default installation options
step1.verify.title: 1.3 Verify Installation
step1.verify.text: Should display version numbers like v18.x.x and 9.x.x
step2.title: Step 2: Install Git
step2.download.title: 2.1 Download Git
step2.download.text: Visit https://git-scm.com and download Git for your operating system
step2.install.title: 2.2 Install Git
step2.install.text: Run the installer and follow the default installation options
step2.config.title: 2.3 Configure Git (First Time)
step2.verify.title: 2.4 Verify Installation
step3.title: Step 3: Install Claude Code
step3.install.title: 3.1 Global Installation
step3.verify.title: 3.2 Verify Installation
step3.verify.text: Should display Claude Code version information
step4.title: Step 4: Install Claude Code Router
step4.install.title: 4.1 Global Installation
step4.verify.title: 4.2 Verify Installation
step5.title: Step 5: Start Router Service
step5.start.title: 5.1 Start Router
step5.start.text: Router will run in background on default port 3456
step5.verify.title: 5.2 Verify Router is Running
step6.title: Step 6: Configure Chameleon Extension
step6.settings.title: 6.1 Open Settings
step6.settings.text: Press Ctrl+, (Windows/Linux) or Cmd+, (macOS) in VS Code to open settings
step6.api.title: 6.2 Configure API Keys
step6.api.text: Configure API keys for your chosen AI providers in Chameleon settings
troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.item1: Command not found: Restart VS Code after installation to refresh PATH
troubleshooting.item2: Permission errors: Ensure running commands with administrator privileges
troubleshooting.item3: Network issues: Check firewall and proxy settings
troubleshooting.item4: Router won't start: Check if port 3456 is already in use
troubleshooting.item5: Git not found: Ensure Git is installed and restart VS Code
nextSteps.title: Next Steps
nextSteps.item1: Use AI chat assistant for intelligent conversations
nextSteps.item3: Test connections to ensure everything works properly
